newsitem.title: ITALY: Compart seen returning to Mib30 index.
newsitem.headline: Compart seen returning to Mib30 index.

text.p: London-based stock analysts Actinvest said Italian financial holding Compart, formerly known as Ferruzzi, could return to Italy's index of 30 blue-chip stocks, the Mib30, when a regular revision is made in March.
It was likely to take the place of insurance and financial services group Mediolanum, Actinvest forecast, when the index revision took effect on March 24.
Compart left the blue-chip index in September, the last time it was revised, and Mediolanum entered.

"The capitalisation and liquidity index calculated using average prices and volumes of the last six months have a value of 4.139 billion (for Compart), bigger than that for Mediolanum," it said in a research note, adding it forecast Compart could increase further.
